intro: Eurycoma merguensis, commonly known as the Malayan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Eurycoma merguensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
